title: Corte Sermana 2015 Cromalgo  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of toasted almond, white flower, dried herb and orchard fruit lead the way. It's round and fresh, with flavors evoking mature yellow apple, candied nectarine and a hint of thyme.

title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: The floral nose recalls bright dandelion and dried orange zest. The palate has a concentrated phenolic richness that adds a bitter, textured edge to this generous wine. The finish is off dry, fresh and zesty.

title: Ceuso 2016 Scurati Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: Aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose while the crisp palate offers citrus peel and peach. Bright acidity gives it a clean refreshing finish.

title: Château de Montfort 2015 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)
description: This off-dry character is a hard style to work well. This wine succeeds because it has kept a dry background as well as strong minerality, so the almond-perfumed character of the wine is beautifully restrained and delicate. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Château Gaudrelle NV Vigneau Brut  (Vouvray)
description: This stylish wine is tight, crisp and with fine intense acidity. Its apple fruitiness is bright, delicious and refreshing. With its lively aftertaste, this is ready to drink now.

title: Château Goudichaud 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This full-bodied wine is rounded and soft. With generous red fruits, balanced acidity and a bright aftertaste, it is ready to drink.

title: Château l' Oiseau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Strongly herbal, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is fruity and crisp, with a good depth of flavor. Refreshing acidity adds a tight edge to this young wine. Drink from late 2017.

title: Château la Freynelle 2016 La Freynelle Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Véronique Barthe is the first woman to manage the estate that has been in the Barthe family since 1789. She delivered a light and bright wine, poised and stylish with its crisp fruit and tangy acidity. A delicious burst of citrus at the end continues the theme of this fruity wine.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2014 Viña Zaco  (Rioja)
description: This wine's heavy oak aromas are toasty but not overdone, while bacon and tobacco notes lurk in the background. Its raw, supremely tannic palate delivers woody, spicy berry flavors.

title: Breca 2016 De Fuego Old Vines Rosé Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: While there's barely any color to this Garnacha rosé, it's a good, albeit pedestrian, wine. Light and clean on the nose, it tastes of lightly sugared red fruits and nectarine. The finish is just racy and cleansing enough.

title: Brkic 2015 Žilavka (Mostar)
description: This 100% Žilavka is medium straw colored and has aromas of lemon zest and dried Mediterranean herbs. Flavors of Bartlett pear, sage, and oregano lead to a tart but savory finish.

title: Cameron Hughes 2014 Lot 606 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a juicy, supple, medium-bodied wine with toasted oak that presents as cedar, pencil shaving, planky wood and vanilla notes.

title: Capçanes 2015 Mas Picosa de Flor en Flor Red (Montsant)
description: Rubbery red berry aromas are more than satisfactory for this type of Garnacha blend. Its linear, light-bodied palate is fresh and punchy, with salty plum and berry flavors. While not very extracted, it lasts on the finish.
designation: Mas Picosa de Flor en Flor

title: Steele 2013 Goodchild Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied red and purple fruit meets mocha and cola spice on the nose of this bottling, which is approachable and simple. The palate is tart with cranberry and plum skin flavors, lifted by dried ginger spice.

title: Slow Press 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Welcoming bubblegum, key lime, grass and cement aromas check many Sauvignon Blanc boxes in this widely available and reliable bottling. The palate leads with decent structure, but then ripeness prevails, with peach and more bubblegum notes.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Portugal Ramos Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: This is a finely made wine, fresh and crisp. It is dry but with a soft texture that turns it into a wine that's both good with food and as an apéritif. The aftertaste is crisp and still fruity.

title: Joseph Carr 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: With its strong green olive aroma, this wine evolves into richly concentrated palate of anise, pineapple and pear, the fruit layered with vanilla. Light-bodied and supported by oak, it finishes bright.

title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Meritage (Rutherford)
description: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc, this friendly bottling offers perfumed oak and simple red fruit. Moderate in structure and body, with healthy fruit ripeness, it finishes with a cedar note.

title: Le Casematte 2016 Rosematte Nerello Mascalese Rosato (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made with Nerello Mascalese, this has enticing scents of Spanish broom, red berry and Mediterranean brush. The lively palate offers cherry, orange zest and chopped herb alongside refreshing acidity.

title: Markham 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Likably round and approachable, this medium-bodied red is mellow and fruity, showing red cherry fruit spiked with vanilla bean. It finishes on charred oak.

title: Fullerton 2015 Five Faces Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Still a bit fragmented, this offers a core of tight apple and peach fruit. It was barrel fermented (10% new) and that shell of barrel flavors has not yet smoothed into the fruit. Give it brisk aeration or another year in the bottle.

title: Martin Ray 2014 Synthesis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon with 6% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot from several appellations within the Napa Valley is soft and smoothly textured, offering brawny black cherry and toasted wood flavors.

title: Gorman 2014 Black Curtain Reserve Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas are light, with notes of potpourri, barrel spices, game and dark fruit. The black-cherry flavors are tart and puckering, also showing tannic grip. This wine seems disjointed at present.

title: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2016  Rosé de Loire
description: This is a dry style of rosé. Packed with red currant and berry fruits, this blend of Cabernet Franc and Grolleau has a touch of spice to add extra interest. It is perfumed, crisp and ready to drink young.

title: Domaine Sauvat 2015 Les Demoiselles Gamay (Côtes d'Auvergne)
description: From the cru village of Boudes, this wine is now mature with its soft red fruits and juicy acidity creating a fruity refreshing wine. The wine, produced on the edge of France's central mountains comes from vineyards that are just a couple of mountain ranges away from Beaujolais in a direct line to the east.

title: Dopff & Irion 2016 Cuvée René Dopff Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Muddy, earthy notes enter the fruity fray of peach on the nose. The palate comes across as clean and zesty. The body is fresh, fruity and easy with an off-dry finish.

title: Doqi 2015 Rkatsiteli (Georgia)
description: Light straw in color, this wine has a bright nose of pineapple and grapefruit. It fills the mouth with flavors of grapefruit and pineapple, with a touch of quince. The finish is a tad tart, with a pleasant note of passion fruit.

title: Drumheller 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Though labeled as Merlot, this smells more like Syrah which makes up 20% of the blend, with aromas of blue and purple fruit along with whiffs of smoked meat and dried herb. The fruit flavors are sweet and plump, backed by soft, luxurious tannins. It's enjoyable but doesn't seem varietally correct.

title: Nodland 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas are barrel forward, with notes of char, vanilla, toast and sweet spice. The barrel notes continue on the palate, overwhelming the fruit almost completely. It's a shame as there's good things to be had underneath.

title: Paraduxx 2013 Red (Howell Mountain)
description: This combines 65% Cabernet Sauvignon and 35% Zinfandel into a voluptuously lush and rounded package of blackberry fruit and tobacco leaf flavor. The texture is dusty and gravelly, complementing the jammy ripeness.
